newsitem.title: TURKEY: U.S. defence chief to Turkey for Iraq talks.
newsitem.headline: U.S. defence chief to Turkey for Iraq talks.

text.p: U.S. Defence Secretary William Perry was to arrive in Ankara on Sunday for consultations with NATO ally Turkey on the Iraq crisis, the U.S. embassy said.
"We can confirm he is coming today," an embassy spokeswoman said.

Perry, on a Middle East tour to shore up the anti-Iraq Gulf War coalition that ended Baghdad's 1990-91 occupation of Kuwait, warned on Sunday that further U.S. strikes on Iraq were still a possibility.
Asked whether more U.S. raids on Iraq were still possible, he told a news conference in Kuwait: "Yes, it is still a possibility."

Turkey hosts a U.S.-led allied air force that patrols a no-fly zone over northern Iraq. Iraqi forces fired a missile at one of the jets last week. The missile missed but the incident prompted Washington to boost its planes and warships in the region for a possible attack on Iraq.
The Turkish general staff said in a statement that Perry would meet armed forces chief Ismail Hakki Karadayi on Tuesday morning.
